result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Garret S. Wilder

records.addlTxt: 10:32 AM Defendant Garret S. Wilder not in court.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Garret S. Wilder.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin. No explanation why defendant is not here.  State asking for a warrant Bench warrant was requested and authorized to be issued on the defendants failure to appear.

11:39 AM Defendant Garret S. Wilder in court.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Garret S. Wilder.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 10:40 am.

.The defendant shall have no contact with M.K.M. or her residence of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.   Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.   Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.
AMENDED   05/24/2022  Exception, Defendant may attend any OB or doctor appointments regarding their unborn child.
AMENDED 08/09/2022  Defendant shall have no abusive, violent or otherwise disorderly contact with MKM, they are not to reside together.
Waived reading of Information The Defendant Entered a plea of not guilty.

1:32 PM Defendant Garret S. Wilder in court.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Garret S. Wilder.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing waived.    The Court finds that the defendant has waived his right to a preliminary hearing, intelligently, knowingly and of his own free will and accepts the waiver, finds probable cause and binds the case over for further proceedings.  Victim present and wishes to amend the bond to allow contact.  State objects
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:17 PM Defendant Garret S. Wilder in court.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Garret S. Wilder.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Waived reading of the complaint Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint. Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Letter received asking to amend bond, victim is not present and she would need to be present
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

09:44 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Garret S. Wilder appeared, pro se.  Needs to call the Public Defender in our area.  Defense is asking for the no contact be lifted - Granted.  State objects.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
Safety Planning Letter May 22.2022
from Victim to modify bond
Initial appearance on May 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.

.The defendant shall have no contact with M.K.M. or her residence of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.   Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.   Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.
AMENDED   05/24/2022  Exception, Defendant may attend any OB or doctor appointments regarding their unborn child.

01:06 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Garret S. Wilder appeared, pro se by video from Clark County Jail.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
